iterator.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002     @file
00003     iterator - patch iterator
00004     jeremy bernstein - jeremy@bootsquad.com 
00005 
00006     @ingroup    examples    
00007 */
00008 
00009 #include "ext.h"                            // standard Max include, always required
00010 #include "ext_obex.h"                       // required for new style Max object
00011 #include "jpatcher_api.h"
00012 
00013 ////////////////////////// object struct
00014 typedef struct _iterator 
00015 {
00016     t_object                    a_ob;           // the object itself (must be first)
00017     t_pt                        a_cached;
00018 } t_iterator;
00019 
00020 ///////////////////////// function prototypes
00021 //// standard set
00022 void *iterator_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00023 void iterator_free(t_iterator *x);
00024 void iterator_assist(t_iterator *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00025 //// additional methods
00026 void iterator_bang(t_iterator *x); // incoming bang message
00027 void iterator_notify(t_iterator *x, t_symbol *s, t_symbol *msg, void *sender, void *data);
00028 
00029 //////////////////////// global class pointer variable
00030 void *iterator_class;
00031 
00032 int main(void)
00033 {   
00034     t_class *c;
00035         
00036     c = class_new("iterator", (method)iterator_new, (method)iterator_free, (long)sizeof(t_iterator), 0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00037 
00038     class_addmethod(c, (method)iterator_bang, "bang", 0);
00039     class_addmethod(c, (method)iterator_assist,         "assist",       A_CANT, 0);  
00040     class_addmethod(c, (method)iterator_notify,         "notify",       A_CANT, 0);  
00041 
00042     class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00043     iterator_class = c;
00044 
00045     post("I am the iterator object");
00046     return 0;
00047 }
00048 
00049 void iterator_assist(t_iterator *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s)
00050 {
00051     if (m == ASSIST_INLET) { //inlet
00052         sprintf(s, "I am inlet %ld", a);
00053     } 
00054     else {  // outlet
00055         sprintf(s, "I am outlet %ld", a);           
00056     }
00057 }
00058 
00059 void iterator_bang(t_iterator *x)
00060 {
00061     t_object *jp;
00062     t_object *jb;
00063     t_object *mybox;
00064     t_object *o;
00065     t_rect jr;
00066     t_symbol *scriptingname;
00067     t_max_err err;
00068 
00069     // get the object's parent patcher
00070     err = object_obex_lookup(x, gensym("#P"), (t_object **)&jp);
00071     if (err != MAX_ERR_NONE)
00072         return;
00073     
00074     // get the object's wrapping box
00075     err = object_obex_lookup(x, gensym("#B"), (t_object **)&mybox);
00076     if (err != MAX_ERR_NONE)
00077         return;
00078     
00079     jb = jpatcher_get_firstobject(jp); // get the first BOX in the object list
00080 
00081     while(jb) {
00082         jbox_get_patching_rect(jb, &jr); // x, y, width, height (double)
00083         
00084         object_post((t_object *)x, "found an object at %ld %ld, w %ld, h %ld", (long)jr.x, (long)jr.y, (long)jr.width, (long)jr.height);
00085         
00086         scriptingname = jbox_get_varname(jb); // scripting name
00087         if (scriptingname && scriptingname != gensym(""))
00088             object_post((t_object *)x, " it is named %s...", scriptingname->s_name);
00089         
00090         o = jbox_get_object(jb); // get the box's object (b_firstin in Max4)
00091         post(" it's a(n) %s object...", object_classname(o)->s_name);
00092         
00093         if (jpatcher_is_patcher(o)) {
00094             post(" which is some kind of a patcher. we could recurse here...");
00095             // jpatcher_
00096         }
00097         
00098         if (jb == mybox)
00099             post(" ...and it's me!");
00100         
00101         jb = jbox_get_nextobject(jb); // iterate
00102     }
00103     
00104     // jbox_get_patcher(abox); // get a box's patcher
00105     
00106     // maybe upwards? jpatcher_get_parentpatcher(<#t_object * p#>)
00107 }
00108 
00109 void iterator_notify(t_iterator *x, t_symbol *s, t_symbol *msg, void *sender, void *data)
00110 {
00111 //  post("got %s message from %X (%s)", msg->s_name, sender, s->s_name);
00112     if (msg == gensym("attr_modified")) { // sent when an attribute of the sender changes
00113         t_symbol *attrname;
00114         
00115         // 'data' arg is the modified attribute object
00116         // get its name:
00117         attrname = (t_symbol *)object_method(data, gensym("getname"));
00118         post("'%s' attribute was modified", attrname->s_name);
00119         
00120         if (attrname == gensym("rect")) {
00121             t_atom *av = NULL;
00122             long ac = 0;
00123             
00124             object_attr_getvalueof(sender, attrname, &ac, &av);
00125             if (ac && av) {
00126                 t_object *jb;
00127                 
00128                 post("new rect: %ld %ld %ld %ld", atom_getlong(av), atom_getlong(av+1), atom_getlong(av+2), atom_getlong(av+3));
00129                 object_obex_lookup(x, gensym("#B"), &jb);
00130                 if (jb) {
00131                     t_atom *rv = NULL;
00132                     long rc = 0;
00133                     
00134                     object_attr_getvalueof(jb, gensym("patching_rect"), &rc, &rv);
00135                     if (rc && rv) {
00136                         // we have box rect
00137                         // compare cached view size to current view
00138                         long dx = atom_getlong(av+2) - x->a_cached.x;
00139                         long dy = atom_getlong(av+3) - x->a_cached.y;
00140                         long boxw = atom_getlong(rv+2);
00141                         long boxh = atom_getlong(rv+3);
00142                         
00143                         // recache new size
00144                         x->a_cached.x = atom_getlong(av+2);
00145                         x->a_cached.y = atom_getlong(av+3);
00146                         
00147                         // modify my box width
00148                         atom_setlong(rv+2, boxw + dx);
00149                         // (height is ignored by jnewobj)
00150                         atom_setlong(rv+3, boxh + dy);
00151                         object_attr_setvalueof(jb, gensym("patching_rect"), rc, rv);
00152                         freebytes(rv, sizeof(t_atom) * rc);
00153                     }
00154                 }
00155                 freebytes(av, sizeof(t_atom) * ac);
00156             }           
00157         }
00158  
00159     }
00160 
00161 }
00162 
00163 void iterator_free(t_iterator *x)
00164 {
00165     t_object *jp = NULL;
00166     t_object *pv;
00167     
00168     // detach from any objects that you have attached to.
00169     object_obex_lookup(x, gensym("#P"), &jp);
00170     if (jp) {
00171         pv = jpatcher_get_firstview(jp);
00172         object_detach_byptr(x, pv);
00173     }
00174 }
00175 
00176 void *iterator_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00177 {
00178     t_iterator *x = NULL;
00179     
00180 //  t_object *patcher = gensym("#P")->s_thing;
00181 //  t_object *box = gensym("#B")->s_thing;
00182     
00183     if (x = (t_iterator *)object_alloc(iterator_class)) {
00184         t_object *pv;
00185         
00186         // this will only work if the patcher is visible
00187         // beware!
00188         pv = jpatcher_get_firstview(gensym("#P")->s_thing);
00189         // pv happens to be a registered object
00190         // so we can attach to it using object_attach_byptr.
00191         // david mentioned object_attach_byptr_register() for
00192         // more advanced attachment applications.
00193         object_attach_byptr(x, pv); // new for Max 5        
00194         {
00195             t_atom *av = NULL;
00196             long ac = 0;
00197             
00198             // get the bounds of the first patcherview
00199             object_attr_getvalueof(pv, gensym("rect"), &ac, &av);
00200             if (ac && av) {
00201                 x->a_cached.x = atom_getfloat(av+2); // width
00202                 x->a_cached.y = atom_getfloat(av+3); // height
00203                 freebytes(av, sizeof(t_atom) * ac); // or sysmem_freeptr()
00204             }
00205         }
00206     }
00207     return (x);
00208 }
